Posted By: SyntheticDreamer (9/25/2012 7:32:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Anyone who rated her less than a 4 doesn't understand the power she has. Getting rid of three of their creatures, or three problem graveyard-shenanigan dudes they have, or getting back three of your dudes when she comes in is *really* strong - that's more often than not an entire board state turnaround. And a 5/6 flier is very strong on its own right. And the fact that the cards return to their owners' *hands* - so they still don't immediately get their dudes back, or they have to find another way to put their guys in their graveyard - that's so key.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: This card is severely underrated. It is a huge bomb, exiling you opponents' fatties, even ones wich pose a threat from their graveyards. Even if they don't have something you deem threatening, you can use it to exile creatures from YOUR graveyard, because, "When Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owners' hands." HANDS! HANDS! Even if it gets removed as soon as it came in, you removed the creatures from the battlefield! This card is sick!

Posted By: Purplerooster (10/8/2012 4:52:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Seems decent as a "put me back into the game" but really should just outright kill three creatures for 7 mana. In the deck I'd use this in, what am I getting back from my graveyard? Mana dorks? Sakura-Tribe elders aren't going to convince someone to not kill this.  
As for a reanimator strategy, that seems awful. Sure you nab three creatures, but reanimator is supposed to be fast enough to play through the graveyard hate. That means your opponent won't have 3 creatures for you to eat, and creatures in your graveyard, well, you want to keep them there, so she won't get you much value.  
Overall, a good card to compare this to is not Sun Titan or Avacyn, but [Hoverguard Sweepers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hoverguard Sweepers). Is it a nice toolbox tooth/nail for EDH? Sure. But I don't think it will be rocking standard back and forth. I'd much rather finish with [Armada Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armada Wurm). Smashy smashy is goody goody.
posts.html:
Seems decent as a "put me back into the game" but really should just outright kill three creatures for 7 mana. In the deck I'd use this in, what am I getting back from my graveyard? Mana dorks? Sakura-Tribe elders aren't going to convince someone to not kill this.
As for a reanimator strategy, that seems awful. Sure you nab three creatures, but reanimator is supposed to be fast enough to play through the graveyard hate. That means your opponent won't have 3 creatures for you to eat, and creatures in your graveyard, well, you want to keep them there, so she won't get you much value.
Overall, a good card to compare this to is not Sun Titan or Avacyn, but Hoverguard Sweepers. Is it a nice toolbox tooth/nail for EDH? Sure. But I don't think it will be rocking standard back and forth. I'd much rather finish with Armada Wurm. Smashy smashy is goody goody.
